title.value: Carbon capture, utilization and sequestration systems design and operation optimization: Assessment and perspectives of artificial intelligence opportunities
title.justification: The title is clearly stated on the first page of the paper.
title.quote: Carbon capture, utilization and sequestration systems design and operation optimization: Assessment and perspectives of artificial intelligence opportunities

extractions.description: This paper reviews carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration (CCUS) technologies and evaluates the application of artificial intelligence (AI) as a data-driven approach in CCUS. It discusses the limitations of existing methodologies and proposes new opportunities in AI for optimizing CCUS system performance.

type.justification: The paper conducts a critical literature review and evaluates technologies and methodologies, which aligns with empirical research.
type.quote: Thus, a critical literature review is conducted to assess CCUS technologies and their related process modeling/simulation/optimization techniques, while evaluating the needs for...

name.justification: The paper focuses on utilizing AI for optimizing carbon capture, utilization, and sequestration systems.
name.quote: The application of artificial intelligence (AI), as a data-driven approach, in CCUS was reviewed and evaluated.

name.justification: The paper is specifically centered around CCUS technologies in the context of AI applications.
name.quote: Carbon capture, utilization and sequestration (CCUS) technologies were reviewed.

name.justification: The paper references machine learning as part of the AI approaches used for CCUS optimization.
The paper lists reinforcement learning as one of the AI methodologies employed for CCUS.
Surrogate costing models are explicitly mentioned as models used within the paper's framework.

is_contributed.justification: The paper discusses the use of surrogate costing models but does not claim to have contributed or developed them.

is_executed.justification: The models are discussed within the scope of the review but are not executed as part of a study or experiment.

is_compared.justification: The models are evaluated as part of comparing different methodologies for CCUS optimization.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper title provided for the surrogate costing models.

name.justification: Simulation-based optimization models are mentioned as part of the methodologies in the paper.

is_contributed.justification: The paper reviews simulation-based optimization and its application but does not claim to contribute these models.

is_executed.justification: The models are part of the paper's literature review and discussion and not executed in experiments.

is_compared.justification: These models are assessed as part of the review among different techniques for CCUS.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper title provided for simulation-based optimization models.
